
A careless developer used RSA with moduli from the product of two Blum primes. Can you decrypt the secret flag? Ciphertext: 6295944943530420469506115953237900485534431502170884485035771134300841353627805372662138193836828755065356672613272622701935072218460385539420184822824328


The flag format is flag{...}
n=8260914706619691124600249442124353289639389212317031461524766559441633695002248002131007385979598149353213201812216870547540732287807642758724435286725053, e=1966311492499037109183881294915144358343595440335388484110598753541060327258359508952391286751034938070844030421852269411844571660682670930229473623424663
The lower 104 bits of p are: 41103455070156378700321134379383145411


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{111xmg4g}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 6295944943530420469506115953237900485534431502170884485035771134300841353627805372662138193836828755065356672613272622701935072218460385539420184822824328
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8260914706619691124600249442124353289639389212317031461524766559441633695002248002131007385979598149353213201812216870547540732287807642758724435286725053, e=1966311492499037109183881294915144358343595440335388484110598753541060327258359508952391286751034938070844030421852269411844571660682670930229473623424663
The lower 104 bits of p are: 41103455070156378700321134379383145411

extra_info: p=79885240978105172410479239531001944279649541819516574726532645445363383944131, q=103409773889069575379671866159071395717709027190545914853729223555206506740863, Ï†(n)=8260914706619691124600249442124353289639389212317031461524766559441633695002064707116140211231807998247523128472219511978530669798227380889723865396040060
subtype: blum_integers
